intro: Godetia bifrons, commonly known as the common godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in racemose inflorescences. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are typically alternate in arrangement. Godetia bifrons is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
